translated: The Book of Conditional RelationsğŸ”½The Chapter on the TriadğŸ”½In the case of a wholesome state of consciousness accompanied by applied thought: There is resultant-ineffective consciousness with applied thought and without sustained thought, and there is the materiality derived by kamma performed in a wholesome state of consciousness accompanied by applied thought.ğŸ”½In the case of an unwholesome state of consciousness accompanied by applied thought: There is resultant-ineffective consciousness with applied thought and without sustained thought, and there is the materiality derived by kamma performed in an unwholesome state of consciousness accompanied by applied thought.

translated: In the case of a state of consciousness that is indeterminate and has a root-cause that is indeterminate: There is resultant-ineffective consciousness with applied thought and without sustained thought, and there is the materiality derived by kamma performed in a state of consciousness that is indeterminate and has a root-cause that is indeterminate.
